questions.question: Why is the ocean important to us?

choices.answer: It makes the sky blue
It keeps the Earth from tilting off its axis
It regulates climate & stores most of the CO2 we produce

questions.question: What are some of the ways that we learn what we know about Earth's ocean?

choices.answer: Buoys & ships collect data like salinity & temperature
Scientists process data to understand the state of the ocean
Sensors attached to fish & marine mammals collect data
All answer choices are accurate

questions.question: Which of the following do we rely on the ocean for?

choices.answer: Lumber for building ships
Energy, food, recreation, & transportation
Habitat for citrus & other fruit trees
Coffee & chocolate

questions.question: Why is the ocean an important reservoir for heat in Earth's climate system?

choices.answer: There are so many fish & mammals who live there
The sun shines on the ocean 24 hours per day
Seawater absorbs 1000 times more heat than air
It captures the lava from volcanoes on the seafloor

questions.question: What is the term for sea level rise caused by warming of the ocean?

choices.answer: Gasification
Sea Tides
Thermal Expansion
Ocean Hot Spots

imageMetadata.resources: Photo courtesy of ECoAS Project: www.sealevelrise.ca

questions.resources: Photo courtesy of ECoAS Project: www.sealevelrise.ca

questions.question: Which of the following contributes to global sea level rise?

choices.answer: Arctic sea ice melting
Increased intensity of rain & snowstorms
Antarctic & Greenland ice sheets melting
Floating icebergs melting

questions.question: Ocean circulation is important to Earth's climate because:

choices.answer: It makes the ocean uniformly salty
It transfers heat from the tropics to the polar regions
It causes tsunamis in shallow water
It causes the Earth's rotation around the sun

questions.question: What causes ocean acidification?

choices.answer: Acid rain
Increasing levels of oxygen in the atmosphere
Increasing levels of CO2 in our atmosphere
Dumping toxic chemicals into the ocean

questions.resources:
Privately hosted; 
"What is Ocean Acidification | A Cartoon Crash Course." Pew Research Center, Washington, D.C. (Jan 27, 2016). http://www.pewtrusts.org/en/research-and-analysis/video/2016/what-is-ocean-acidification-a-cartoon-crash-course

questions.question: Warming oceans cause coral bleaching which can lead to coral death. This is a problem because:

choices.answer: Healthy reefs contribute to local economies through tourism
Coral reefs buffer adjacent shorelines from wave action
Coral reefs are among the most diverse ecosystems on Earth
All answer choices are accurate

questions.question: How are warming ocean temperatures impacting whales, fish, & other marine mammals?

choices.answer: They aren't as hungry because it's so hot
Warmer water makes them sleepy
Their migratory patterns are changing
Summer seems longer so fish are schooling less

questions.question: How can Marine Protected Areas help to alleviate the impacts of climate change?

choices.answer: They provide sanctuary for marine life
They promote biodiversity
They protect coastlines
All answer choices are accurate
